website_summaries.verdict: Best in smaller streams, this rod offers great action and accurate casting at a very attractive price.
pros: Fiberglass rod has great flexibility and very good action
Drops lures accurately even into small target areas
cons: Reel seat is a little loose
Minor imperfections in the rod finish
Action can be slow when using lighter weight line

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and versatile rod with great action
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding fly rod, and not just because it is the cheapest glass rod in the business. The fiberglass action feels great. I have used it to catch springtime bass with topwater poppers, trout in New Mexico Mountains, trout in Oklahomas Lower Illinois River, and caught up to 5 lb catfish with bread cube flies in community lakes. Like others here, I used 5wt weight forward floating line instead of 3/4 wt. the 3/4 wt White River Fly Shop Dogwood reel is a perfect match for this rod. Just be sure the second piece is inserted snug before you start fishing, otherwise it may go flying out during casting.
customer_reviews.author: ljt

customer_reviews.title: fun rod
customer_reviews.text: I found one of these at Walmart and it felt like a noodle. I knew i had to have one for blue gill. i spooled it up with rio 3 wt, and casted dry fly ants, to small woolly buggers and it is a fun rod to cast. The challenge i found was with landing fish, there simply is a lack of back bone making it hard to play the fish without loosing it. I was just catching small bluegills. This may be designed more for broke trout but is still fun. i just wish it was slightly longer, but its just bluegill at the end of the day for sport rather than food, so it serves its purpose
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great rod for smaller streams
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for smaller streams. I put a Redington reel on here and caught many wild brook trout with it. Always helps to have a smaller rod for tight areas where there are lots of trees and brush. For the price, you really can't beat it. The only gripe I have with it is the reel seat. The bottom ring that goes over the reel attachment point is a perfect circle, but most higher end rods have this ring notched out to allow a tight fit. My reel is a little loose, which bothers me to some degree, but doesn't affect rod performance. Mainly just an aesthetic concern over function.
customer_reviews.author: Lee H.

customer_reviews.title: Great rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to get into the fiberglass market this is where you can start. A great rod, super fun to fish with, and matched with a lightweight reel and line you'll have a great tie chasing fish. I took it up to some alpine streams and lakes and loved fishing with it. I have 5 other rods and this has become one of my most favorite to fish with. To be clear, it came in the 3/4 weight as stated. It is a 2 piece rod. Really great deal. I wish Eagle Claw would bring back their Sweetwater rod.
customer_reviews.author: IronTri

customer_reviews.title: Great rod for beginners, super fun rod for more advanced folks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to learn on. She isn't really interested in fly casting yet so I have been using it instead of mine. I have some nice gear, but this little rod is a riot! Especially for the price. And the quality is tight. This rod is in it's own little niche. It's long enough to be useful but not so long as to be a full on fly rod. It's just a really low commitment rod with solid performance. You aren't going to throw any heavy flies or use any 12' leaders, but for dry and light streamers it's a gas.
customer_reviews.author: Like It Is

customer_reviews.title: Fun fly rod
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing value. It has a fairly slow action compared to most graphite rods, which is great for small stream dry fly action. It takes some patience with a slower rod, but it's a fun addition to your fly rod quiver and because it's so cheap, you won't be too sad if it breaks. My 5 yr old son is using it to learn fly casting. Buy a really cheap reel and 4 wt line and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: k stew

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent rod. I have an 8
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent rod. I have an 8.5' Orvis 5 weight rod that is nice, but this one fits the bill, where I needed/wanted a shorter lightweight rod for smaller streams or such. It does cast 3 weight lines -- actually, I put a WF2F on mine and have no problems, just move it slower. I tried WF5F and although it works it did seem heavy in the casting. The reel ring is the only complaint I would have in that it does not seem to be as secure when tightened on some reels (which do work on other rods). This is my 2nd Eagle Claw rod (I have a lightweight spinning combo) with no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: D. In VA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to beat the value that this fly rod offers. After doing some research on line, it was recommended to use a heavier line for best performance. This short fiberglass rod, paired with a 5wt reel/line, is perfect for the small trout waters. Here in eastern wisconsin. Cons: tip will not last long if its hanging out the backseat window and you go to roll it up to make a phone call.
customer_reviews.author: joe grace

customer_reviews.title: Buy 3!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing to get into fly fishing, as a backup rod, or something near indestructible for kids. At 6ft your not going to throw long distance but it’s quite accurate for anything inside 30ft. The ruler is a great touch, and fighting fish feels much more fun with this thing. My opinion is a great keep in vehicle dry fly rod that you can bang around on. Impressed and will be buying 8ft version!
customer_reviews.author: Jon M

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Have been using 5wt rods on little streams for a while, using the proper weight rod is life changing. Tough rod too, I buy cheap rods and abuse them, they live in my trunk and get strapped to the side of backpacks for airline rides and bushwacking. This rod is clearly much better made than the average cheap rod and has survived longer than the others, will be buying another if I kill this one.
customer_reviews.author: David Baer

customer_reviews.title: niceee
customer_reviews.text: ggggggggggg kinda weird how the vibration goes through the handle and makes the handle shake, unlike my $~600 graphite 6 weight Sage VT2 BUT maybe that's just cuz it's a 3 weight.. anyways it feels just different but not in a bad way, theres a lot of action there for a $25 rod so I can't hate ... it's a two piece btw.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Randall

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap rod!
customer_reviews.text: Rod seems perfect for small lakes, streams, and ponds. I plan on using it for small pond and stream fishing. I paid it with a gold 5wt Croch reel and the combo is perfect for bass fishing in tight quarters or where there are trees near. Will update review once I have used it more.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Rod for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 6'6" 3/4 weight and that is what I received. The wood inlay in the reel seat is nice. Paired with my Medalist 1492, this is a sharp-looking rod. So far I've used it for bluegill and its done the trick. However, I doubt that it has the backbone for larger fish. I caught a small bass on it and struggled to get it out of the water due to the soft flex. However, slow it down and it casts nicely.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. You'll like it.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this little rod. It's crazy cheap, it's fun to cast and pan fish on this rod are a blast. It's a great rod to teach with, as it is super easy to cast and gives lots of feedback when line is loading and unloading. I only wish it was a 3 piece rod and had a second reel locking ring, but for the price I will not complain. Otherwise its one of my favorites and one i recommend to anyone looking to try out fly fishing without spending a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: FUN rod
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight 6'6" fiberglass flyrod that is a joy to fish with and a blast to catch bass on. It is not a long range rod, but it does well with normal "fishing distance " cast. It is slower than graphite, but it easy to adjust to. Get a nice 2-3 lb bass on this and hold on! You have a fight on your hands. I am thoroughly pleased with it. It is my new go to outfit. To easy to much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Caruthers

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: With out a doubt buy it arrived very fast, 3-4 weight 6.6 feet long great for those narrow streams. Very flexible great action. Spice it up with one of your favorite reels, you cant go wrong!!!!! 25 Year fly fishing veteran.
customer_reviews.author: flash1027

customer_reviews.title: Such a great value. I got 5 weight line on and ...
customer_reviews.text: Such a great value. I got 5 weight line on and works good. Really love the action of fiberglass. I seem to cast farther and feel it loads nicer than graphite. But either way this is a great rod you won't be sorry. With a nice heavy reel like the crotch it has superb balance. Better than my expensive graphite rods
customer_reviews.author: Tindall Knives

customer_reviews.title: Fair price, nice feel, decent looking.
customer_reviews.text: Its very slow, I use it for close up areas. I have WF3-F generic Aventik 2 color in Milk/Blue on it and the line is too light to load the rod. The line seems too small for its rated size though, a good 3wt might be good to go. No issues with the rod, its doing what it should with a nostalgic vintage feel.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Reedy

customer_reviews.title: ... minutes from home that is populated by some surprisingly nice brookies but it is well guarded by hordes of ...
customer_reviews.text: So I fish this little mountain stream 20 minutes from home that is populated by some surprisingly nice brookies but it is well guarded by hordes of mosquitoes, a maze of fallen logs, and heavily hemmed in by bushes/branches. It's pretty tough/snaggy going with a normal sized 9' fly rod. This little unit rigged up with a 7-foot 5x leader and a #14 parachute adams is just the ticket...
customer_reviews.author: Ensi

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this rod all summer after breaking my $200 carbon rod. It is the perfect small stream fish slayer, and I’ve even used in in a personal pontoon and caught some 14 inch fish in Montana. Can’t beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget rod for small streams
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat these rods for the price. Are they the best rods you can buy? No, and if you think you will get that for $25 you're dreaming. They are very nice rods for the money and ones you don't feel like you have to baby. The 6'6" 3/4 wt is perfect for small trout streams that don't have as much space to cast. You won't win any distance contests, but then again you don't need to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An absolute steal!
customer_reviews.text: My very first fly rod snapped leaving me with an extra 4 weight reel. I had been looking for something to attach it to and found this. I haven’t had a chance to use it yet, but the rod is great. The reel seat is fantastic and at 6’6” the reel is perfect for tight areas! Can’t wait to get out on the water with it!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Slaybaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: At my skill level this rod is PERFECT. I'm a beginner and know 100% that a more expensive rod would not help me catch more fish. This one's perfect for learning and I've had it for years now. My friends with rod/reel combos that cost 10x more do not catch more fish than me. Whether you're starting out or just looking for a capable budget setup, I highly recommend this rod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 2 years, still a great rod
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod 2 years ago and it's my go-to rod for small to medium Colorado streams. Easy to cast, compact, and can handle a rough lifestyle (I've broken rods before). Can't say enough good things about this little rod!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a half-dozen short fly rods, about equally divided between fiberglass and graphite. The 6'6" glass Eagle Claw I bought recently from Amazon will pitch a line about as well as any of them. At $26 and change delivered, it has to be one of the best bargains around. But l did heed what some other buyers have said about line weight and started out with a #5. I'll probably get around to trying a #3 or #4, but I'm so pleased with the way the EC casts with the heavier line that it may be a while.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little rod
customer_reviews.text: Truly one of the best buys around. You will have to find a 42” case for it. I’m using a Plano model I bought here on amazon, after padding the inside. The rod’s cork is a half Wells, not the cigar shape in ad photo. Fiberglass is much more durable than graphite and teaches you to cast with more of a relaxed, patient tempo to load the rod,..but you already know that. I think I’ll buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Mandopaul

customer_reviews.title: Fun small creek fly rod
customer_reviews.text: Good rod for small streams and light flies. Add any weight and the performance goes downhill. Very slow action compared to other quality slow action rods. Use the lightest fly line you can. Not much backbone during casting and retrieving fish. Fit and finish are great. Looks more expensive than $25. A great rod for beginners. Handles blue gill like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rod for the money!
customer_reviews.text: My dad and I got one of these to keep in the work vehicle. Got to fish it the other day. It worked wonderfully. It casted very well when I adjusted my technique. I caught a nice smallmouth with it. It put a nice bend in it haha. This rod casted best for me with a 4wt line. I used a double taper line. I also paired it with a Martin tuna can reel and made a case from electrical conduit. The rod is an excellent value. It's inexpensive, simple, performs well, and has fun levels off the charts!
customer_reviews.author: ponycarman

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe that $25 bucks gets you this fun. The last time $25 got me this much ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I can't believe that $25 bucks gets you this fun. The last time $25 got me this much fun, it was on my bachelor party in New Orleans. If you are considering this, buy it. It's worth it. I bought it for a small creek near my house and catch 20-30 fish on a stretch that's about 10 yards wide and small as 5 yards wide at some points. I can accurately throw a fly in a 2 foot "hoop" on the other side with a small amount of space behind me. It's a great value, and you should consider it the best 25 you spent this week.
customer_reviews.author: john david patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small stream rod, but wasn't sure how much I would use it so didn't want to spend to much money. I've only used it once but had a good time goofing around on a narrow mountain stream, and even caught a nice small Brook trout. For how I plan to use it, this is the perfect fly rod.
customer_reviews.author: cgreene

customer_reviews.title: 3/4 wt rod
customer_reviews.text: This rod is short for a fly rod at 6'6". Long casts are tough but this will be a perfect blue lining rod for small streams and rivers. This rod still has good backbone. I used it on a pond last night with 4wt line and it was tough to cast long distance so I will try 3wt line tomorrow and 5 wt after that, so hopefully the rod will like one of the two a little better. Overall, a good value for $25 or so.
customer_reviews.author: JHoward

customer_reviews.title: thanks to EAGLE CLAW
customer_reviews.text: Hi, didnot fished it yet but the quality and action looks like great : ) I am 26 but I love old style action with short / or long rods. This is what I like actually : ) feels solid in hand, great reel seat - think one of the best between my fly rods : ) I never buy expensive rods because I can't but this one is the cheapest and love it too much already : ) recommended stick for beginners : ) thanks to EAGLE CLAW. several my friends will come to buy more : )
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Kakhoberashvili

customer_reviews.title: Casts like a dream and has a good shoot
customer_reviews.text: Casts like a dream and has a good shoot. I have it fitted with an ultralight, wide spool aluminum reel loaded with WF4 line. I might be able to go up to a 5 wt. line, but for me, 3 wt. line would be out of the question. The rod appears to be well made and the gold hardware really gives it a rich look. I am from the old school and have no problem with fiberglass rods. This one is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it falls apart
customer_reviews.text: It was a very good rod to learn to cast fly. Caught 16 inch trout on it no problem and It worked great until the handle started separating. The cork handle is now in two pieces and very uncomfortable to use anymore. Not satisfied with the quality amymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been nothing but impressed with this rod. Mine is for 3/4 (not 4/5) line weight. Rigged with 3-wt, it does great. For small stream fishing in tight quarters, this little guy is the ticket... and you can't beat the price. While this might not perform like an $800 glass rod...this thing is pretty dern impressive for 25 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: franzelli

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Like the size and feel. Wish I was as good at fishing as the rod. Plenty of rod, good as higher priced rods.
customer_reviews.author: M B

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY WHAT I NEEDED FOR THE SHORT CASTS; I ...
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY WHAT I NEEDED FOR THE SHORT CASTS; I CAUGHT A 14" (GUESSED WGHT:1LBS.), WITH IT. MERCY, THOUGHT IT WAS A WHALE- EXPECTED JONAH TO POP OUT OF HER MOUTH!
customer_reviews.author: DONALD DUNN

customer_reviews.title: decent rod
customer_reviews.text: I received the 3/4 wt 6.6 ft model. it has a slow action, which is great. my rod came with a huge paint chip down to the rod core, maybe she will fish fine and not be bothered by the damage?
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great rod, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for creek fishing. Very flexible an you feel all the action. Light weight model doesnt cast as far as medium action but for creek fishing its fantastic. Trout fishing made easy
customer_reviews.author: Mike E.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rod.
customer_reviews.text: Great little #2 weight rod with out breaking the bank. Perfect for the small North Georgia trout streams I fish.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger hamby

customer_reviews.title: Just try to beat this product.
customer_reviews.text: You won't do better for what this rod is . If you don't like it for small Creek fishing or you don't like how it cast your the problem not the rod just saying
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: Several ferrules damaged
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 snake ferrules with epoxy broken and one ferrule bent out of shape. Packaging seemed un dented so must've happened prior to packing. Basically 0 protection inside. Some craft paper to keep it from bouncing around. At $25 though I just re epoxied the ferrules and trued it up by eye. Cast pretty nice just isn't perfect.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like I lucked out and bought the last one! Hopefully, they can get more! This is a 4 weight rod and fits exactly what I need for those small streams with close overgrowth when I'm after those native brookies in VA. I just need to add... It's NOT a $700 Orvis rod! It's so much less pretentious!
customer_reviews.author: bdbdbuck

customer_reviews.title: SO SURPRISINGLY GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: I fish over 40 rods a year and this is easily one of the most fun I own. Small streams with a 5 wt line, and it is a dry fly buttery dream!
customer_reviews.author: Twig N Timber Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece
customer_reviews.text: Order this for my son for a Christmas Present. Quick delivery but once I opened the box I noticed only one part of the fly rod was in the package. The package was missing the tip section. 1/2 of it looks great cannot wait time get a complete rod to see how he likes it. Looks like it will be a New Years Gift. 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for bream fishing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod to be used as a backup rod. There are better rods out there, but this one catches fish just fine. I like it so much that it has become my primary go to rod. I fish the rivers in North West Florida and it casts nicely. For my setup I use a floating level 4 weight line, use a 8-12 lb test mono leader and use "Bea Bea Bugs" made in Wewahitchka Fl. Buy one, you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: jp79

customer_reviews.title: Glass is not dead.
customer_reviews.text: Eagle claw, quality! very flexy can't wait to tie into some 10" bluegill!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon King

customer_reviews.title: Great setup for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for the price. I have always been a sucker for value, and this rod has it all for the price point. I paired it with an Okuma Sierra 3/4 reel and 4wt SA Aircel fly lime and it balances perfectly. Would recommend this rod for anyone trying to get into small creek fishing or just trying to make their experience more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing rod!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent 3/4 rod. Very well built and excellent in the hand
customer_reviews.author: Carl Wayne Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Great small rod.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2. One 5'6" and a 6'. Great for small streams and ones with a lot of cover. Fiberglass fly rods have a place. Iowa trout streams is one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great for working narrow stream with a lot of overhanging branches. Bought it with the matching Eagle Claw reel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: a little heavy but gets the job done, very good rod
customer_reviews.author: BBI tackle

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod for the $
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the other reviews I had read, the rod I received was 3/4 weight, not 4/5 weight. I was very pleased, since finding a 3wt rod for under 100 is almost impossible. The rod casts perfectly, with almost a bamboo feel and accuracy to it. This will be my small brook rod from now on. It is perfect for the tight situations I encounter in the backwoods of Maine in pursuit of brookies.
customer_reviews.author: A Tanguay

customer_reviews.title: this is not going to fish like a Sage
customer_reviews.text: No, this is not going to fish like a Sage, Orvis, etc rod. But for $25 it shouldn't. However, if you're thinking of getting into the sport this pole will provide a good facsimile of the fly-fishing experience. In fact, the slight clunkiness forces your technique to be better thus making it well suited to the beginner.
customer_reviews.author: JakeGittes

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable and fishes like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this pole to fish in specific freestone small waters in my local area. Its short length is perfect for trudging through the woods and thick stuff. I was blown away at how well this little fiberglass rod casts and feels for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Eagle Claw
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the poles we have ordered but we have ordered two back to back. Both broken. The poles were just stuck in box with no support or anything to secure it in box. I am ordering another one and sure hope it is not broken when we receive it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M.

customer_reviews.title: Great small stream or pond rod
customer_reviews.text: Great small stream or pond rod. Perfect for parish and trout. My son will be using it from the bank as well as from a kayak. Loads well and smooth casting. Good rod for teaching the fundamentals.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS ROD
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rod for small creeks. Was worried how well it would cast with it being short, but does great!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Buy this rod
customer_reviews.text: Absolute bang for the buck! Used for small stream trout and pond wastewater species. Works flawlessly. Casts easily, even for my six year old
customer_reviews.author: Steven Platek

customer_reviews.title: Only half of the rod came
customer_reviews.text: Im sure the rod would have been great. However. I only got the bottom half of the rod!! No upper half.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod.
customer_reviews.text: This rod is legit. Super flexible. Super light weight. Can’t complain about anything for it only being around $20.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Michael Harper

customer_reviews.title: Eagle claw has been around forever for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for small streams and bank fishing if you dont have much room to backcast. Accurate as you are. As expected, not as good for distance. Read other reviews from more experie ced fishermen for guidance on line weight selection.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo the trout slayer

customer_reviews.title: Nice 3/4 rod
customer_reviews.text: I love this rod. It has been a great rod so far.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best price around
customer_reviews.text: This rod is great you can’t beat it with a stick for the price!!! I bought another one as soon as i seen the first one without even trying it! Now have 7 fish on the first rod I purchased great buy fun rod for the beginner or the experienced!
customer_reviews.author: logon gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Great fly rod at any price
customer_reviews.text: Strong and sensitive. Rugged yet refined. Perfect for a fly rod. For the price can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ACTION, REEL SEAT IS SNUG
customer_reviews.text: FOR THE PRICE, YOU CANNOT BEAT THIS LITTLE ROD! GREAT ACTION, REEL SEAT IS SNUG, HANDLES PAN FISH AS WELL AS ANY OTHER 6'6 ROD I HAVE FISHED.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M.

customer_reviews.title: ... fly fish so far they are picking it up nicely. Good pole to learn on for the smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to teach our kids how to fly fish so far they are picking it up nicely. Good pole to learn on for the smaller kids. We're happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Moriah C.

customer_reviews.title: How is this so cheap??
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this rod for its price. It throws 3 4 and even 5 wt line so smoothly. Very nice looking too!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and fits the application of fishing small streams with ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and fits the application of fishing small streams with lots of canopy. Price was unbelievable for the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod on a whim. I took it to a local lake and had a blast catching bluegill. I may even try it when I go to the river and see how it performs. Just a fun little rod.
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Forbess

customer_reviews.title: Love the shorter length
customer_reviews.text: We were very excited to find a 6’ pole, as it will be just right for our six year-old grandson. It is a perfect length for him to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Hall

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheap back-up rod and have really enjoyed the smooth casting of the parabolic glass. We've found that it works best with 5wt WF fly line.
customer_reviews.author: Yukon Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Perfect value fiberglass rod
customer_reviews.text: Picked up the rod to use in close quarter streams in NC, now it's my go to rod for small bass in roadside waterways back in Florida. Well worth the money and a blast to use.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Skelton

customer_reviews.title: Should have come on a spool. Untied it... took hours straightening it out to reel up.
customer_reviews.text: Excellant. It for sure was a #3 just as ordered. Put it on my Cahill reel and into the Eagle Claw flyrod I had also ordered from Amazin. Worked great on practice casts.
customer_reviews.author: James Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best money i have spent yet on fly fishing gear
customer_reviews.text: Best money i have spent yet on fly fishing gear, I am currently filing a warranty clam on a broken fenwick aetos 180.00 rod and here my 24 dollar eagle claw is keeping me fishing and casts great!
customer_reviews.author: NewMom

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this fly rod as a birthday present for ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fly rod as a birthday present for my 6 year old grandson. His father is an avid fly fisherman. He was quite impressed with the quality of this fly rod. He said it was hard to believe this was such a well made rod for the price! We anticipate many years of fly fishing for my young grandson. Thank you Eagle Claw!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Peele

customer_reviews.title: Great lil rod
customer_reviews.text: Nice lil 3wt wish they made one a tad bit longer. Performs great for small creeks
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: #glassisnotdead
customer_reviews.text: This rod is awesome for the price. Not a real 3/4, it's more of a 4/5 but casts great. I'd pair the rod with a 5double taper line if you want that full flex feel. Def good for a beginner or a back up rod.....I paired mine with an old Martin 63 reel and an orange 5DT line and it looks awesome and retro!
customer_reviews.author: brian foley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value; I bought it to use while kayaking ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value; I bought it to use while kayaking because of its length. Very nice action; looks much more expensive than what it is. Plus, it has a handy ruler on it. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Neo Luddite

customer_reviews.title: Trying to find reasons to use it
customer_reviews.text: Casting distance is cut but accuracy goes up. Really fun to catch bream with.
customer_reviews.author: Buckaroo Bonzai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Lightweigt, super thin, but strong plus you can cast it a mile.
customer_reviews.author: BOB O

customer_reviews.title: fiber....gassed!
customer_reviews.text: I love fiberglass fly rods! The bounce that you get when swinging a fly is forever etched in my memory. A friend of mine bought this rod and I was extremely skeptical. I mean, Eagle Claw, really? Boy was I wrong. And the high-priced world of fly fishing and all of its accoutrement and accessories this is the best deal I've ever gotten for the money. Great little rod!
customer_reviews.author: Freestonebound

customer_reviews.title: I own a spinning version of this rod & love it. Was very excited it see a fly ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a spinning version of this rod & love it. Was very excited it see a fly version. Had it out this past weekend, wasn't disappointed nor we you be if you get one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ziemba

customer_reviews.title: Nice little rod for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice little rod for the price. More backbone than expected. Would cast better with 4wt line I expect, but adequate distance & accuracy with WF 3.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Davis IV

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Glass casts better and keeps fish on the line better than carbon. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: It is absolutely perfect for mountain creeks and streams with thick low hanging ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this little rod for the price. It is absolutely perfect for mountain creeks and streams with thick low hanging limbs and underbrush that a longer rod would get tangled.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Fun. Nice wood reel lock
customer_reviews.text: Fun. Nice wood reel lock. Accurate with dry fly and small streamers. Put wf4 on an Allen reel. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for small streams, eagle claw makes a good economy rod
customer_reviews.author: mike scanlon

customer_reviews.title: It caught me
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little pole for the money. I'm just getting into the fly fishing thing, so I wanted something that wouldn't break the bank if I didn't like it. Also, I'm not going out in the rivers out west, will primarily use it for catching panfish in small lakes and ponds. So I'm not looking for something that will "shoot the line" out 100 feet, or bring home a trophy brown. I just want to have a nice day catching 8" Bluegill. I've had it for close to 2 months now, and I've probably fished it 7-8 times or more. I can't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Just the Fax

customer_reviews.title: like the rod but it's line rating is mislabled.
customer_reviews.text: The rod was listed as a 3/4 weight and the upc/ i.d. plastic sleeve label was 3/4 wgt. however the rod blank is engraved as a 4/5 wgt. After casting the rod the 4/5 weight rating on the blank is correct . this come from 55 years of ffly fishing experience with countless rods. Ray Bondorew Author of "Stripers and Streamers'
customer_reviews.author: Ray Bondorew

customer_reviews.title: Great little beginner rod
customer_reviews.text: Great little beginner rod. The action is MUCH, MUCH better than its price might suggest. Perfect for roll casting dry flies on small mountain streams (it rocks in the smokies). Of note, it is the 3/4wt I received, not the 4/5wt (Only took off one star for that).
customer_reviews.author: benjamin morehead

customer_reviews.title: Product is great!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you the fly rod is like the old one! I like it alot
customer_reviews.author: jane williams

customer_reviews.title: perfect creek rod
customer_reviews.text: A replacement for a rod given to my granddaughter. Perfect with 4 line rollcasting in a creek with brush. Might have trouble with a five pounder, but perfect for panfish.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Biddle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As listed. Well made. Great little rod for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Outlander26

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by this rod. Great bang for your buck. Accurate and balanced. Best to pair with 5wt wf line.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Saenz

customer_reviews.title: excellent deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a present for my buddy. I thought about keeping it. I think I'll be buying one for myself sweet deal
customer_reviews.author: jeeperscrepers

customer_reviews.title: High quality, low price. AKA, perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I have been fly fishing for about a year now, and have had about three cheap rods so far. This one though, by far, is the best i have bought yet. People keep saying this rod is a 5 weight rod, but mine says 3/4 weight. The action on this thing is unreal, it is so smooth,and easy loading rod. It looks just like the rods that cost about $200. Wooden reel seat, and i think the guides, rod butt, and reel lock are brass. Its also got measurements on the rod itself, which is a nice touch. This to me, is the perfect rod for catching panfish. I highly reccomend this to any hardcore panfisher.
customer_reviews.author: Meyer Home Improvement

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great rod excellent value catching brook trout and easy to maneuver thru tight spots
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If i'd have wanted a better rod/reel, I'd have put a "LOT" more money into it.
customer_reviews.author: james ritter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice short fly rod for bank fishing at lakes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. York
